float computeDistance ( MiddleEarth &  me,
string  start,
vector< string >  dests 
)

computes distance from a start point through each city in vector

Given an instance of Middle-Earth, a starting city, and a vector of cities to travel to (in order), the function returns a float distance/cost of travel on a cyclic path that starts and ends at the starting city

Parameters:
meinstance of Middle-Earth
startstart/end city
destsvector of city names to which to travel

References MiddleEarth::getDistance().

Referenced by main().

Brute-force implementation of traveling salesman algorithm Creates an instance of Middle-Earth and finds the shortest cycle through all cities using five command-line params.
